column4: is there anyway to get to my computer that is on my schools network that is not pingable from the internet?
Yeah, I use ssh too. Great thing. :D "sudo apt-get install openssh-client open-sshserver"
What types of connections are you on?
So you're connecting on an intranet?
i believe intranet (it's a school building's LAN, through ethernet, if that helps)
Yep, you're right. So you get a connection, but it keeps dropping? What port are you using?
i cannot get a connection is my problem, i cannot ssh 147.222.178.28 unless i am connected on the same LAN
Yeah. Its going to be difficult to telnet to your computer from anywhere else but from inside the intranet. Have you successfully connected from outside before?
In order to connect to your computer, you'd need the root router (the one that distributes internet to the campus) to directly redirect all SSH connections to your computer
N2DIY, so it's probably impossible for me to?
Not quite sure. Try contacting your sysadmin, see if he has any solutions. Or try a few different ports.
but that IP adress is not even pingable from outside the network, so using a different port wouldnt work right?

No, they have the router set to be not pingable to prevent from attacks. I can't ping my own router, but I can still connect to it. Thing is, I say "forward all port 22" (thats ssh) "to 192.168.1.101" (thats my computer)

When the head router at the campus (connected directly to the internet) gets a packet saying "I want to connect to ssh!" the router says "OK! Where do I send it? There's a million computers on campus."
So you'd need to ask the system administrator to forward one port to your computer. depending on the size of the campus, that may or may not be too hard.
Or possibly he may have a solution for you :P
thanks, don't know if the admin will be helpful, they are assholes here
